comment:
If you show up to class & do the homework, and take notes on both, you'll be fine.
Notecard on the tests, whole sheet of paper on the final! 
Attendance was questions during the lecture on iClicker. 
His PowerPoints are detailed, cover everything on the tests. 
Great with accommodations, always willing to chat after class. Office hours are great!

At first, I did not like the classes because my first quizzes were not awesome. But when I discovered that he wants you to pay attention to small details and actually memorize some things, I hacked it! Also, he is very helpful outside of class and gave me great tips which really helped my performance in the class! I would take him again if I could.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Meyers is caring, respectful, and always willing to help. He offers extra credit, gives detailed study guides, and allows index cards for exams (full sheet for the final). Lectures can be heavy, but he makes them fun. I had him for both lecture and lab by far the best professor I've had in college!

I took professor Meyers for Bio 1108 Lecture for the summer. His quizzes were based off of his lectures and he provides a study guide for each lecture quiz, which really helped me. As long as you pay attention in his lectures you will do fine. You can tell that he is passionate and cares.
Very good. My favorite bio professor. Wish he taught upper-level courses.

Fantastic professor. Gives great, engaging lectures. No idea why his scores are so low on here. I assume people aren't taking notes in class or reading the textbook. His exams are challenging, sure, but if you actually engage in the course and homework you will do just fine. Most people probably cheated on the HW and wonder why they failed.

DO NOT TAKE!!!! Class test average was failing for every test and he did nothing to help improve that. Lectures were long and never knew how to answer questions. Tests are IMPOSSIBLE to do well on. Does a horrible job of preparing and teaching the proper material. I have been a straight A student since elementary school and I barely got a B in this
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is my second semester taking prof. Meyers, I will say this is a challenging class! I failed my first exam but when I started going to office hours, completing the study guides, and listening in class I ended up getting A's on the rest of my exam. I really do believe that he has the best intentions for his students and wants us to succeed.

Honestly he is a nice guy and You can tell he cares about bio, but he is an awful teacher. His tests are extremely hard and the study guides HE MAKES only cover about half of what will be on the exam... Does Iclicker (iykyk). Has taken him the entire semester to grade the "group work" he makes us do. Anatomy gave me less anxiety.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Peter himself is great. His tests are just awful. First test was LONG paragraphs, very hard. Most of the other tests (4 unit tests) had ambiguous answers-study guides useless. Never could figure out how to study for his class material wise. Attendance mandatory for iclicker/partic pts. Group work was silly- had things due 2 nights before final.

His teaching style does NOT reflect the tests he will give you. You're better off reading the textbook and skipping his class. He also gives tons of homework and there are no down periods. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I am a bio major and I had a 4.0 before taking this class. I took him for SCM 2000 and I thought he was easy in that so I thought he would be easy in bio. Boy was I wrong - this class was harder than my chem and calc class combined. The stuff he teaches is not on the tests. He is a nice guy but he really does not teach well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: hes super nice, but outside of okay lectures, there is not much material to teach yourself with. had online homeworks that were graded for accuracy, but the hw was about things we havent been taught. tests were quite difficult, but you could bring a notecard for every test and a whole sheet of paper for the final.

He's a nice guy, but half of the lecture is him rambling about stuff not even relevant to the class. You pretty much have to rely on your own notes from the textbook because his powerpoints barely cover what is on the exams. He also takes AGES to grade assignments. He didn't grade an assignment from january until april…

he is a nice guy and tries to be accessible and help but at the root of it he just is not good at teaching this material. I studied like crazy for this class and am a mostly A student yet I will be ending this course with a B. If you care about actually learning the information and keeping a good GPA, take someone else.

He's a kind person and willing to help if you reach out, but unfortunately, I don't think he's the best professor. The course feels much harder than it should be. The exam averages are very low, questions are overly difficult and unnecessarily long. He seems aware that most students are doing poorly, but still insists the questions are fair.

To be honest, I think every single one of this class's issues could be solved with better study materials and better tests. He is definitely not a bad teacher, but he does not seem to know how to help his students improve on his tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: His lectures can be long and not the most engaging and sometimes he spends a lot of time on material that isn't as important as others. He does iClicker attendance each lecture for attendance and points. His tests are lengthy and worded weirdly where it feels like multiple answers can be right. If you take him, make sure to study the material well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Do. Not. Take. The test average for my class was in the 50/60's for every test and with a class of 140 people, almost 50 dropped because of how hard the course is. No matter how much you study or what you study, the tests will be nothing like the lectures or the textbook or the study guide.

DO NOT TAKE. If you want to fail every test then this is the class for you. His lectures to not cover the depth that the tests cover. Test questions are paragraphs long and are way too in depth for the time allowed. He is a very nice guy but this class is way too difficult for a 1000 level bio class.

He seems like a nice guy however, his lectures cover MAYBE 10% of the content IF THAT. I never missed a day of class, read the textbook everyday, attended SI sessions and still felt like I was unable to grasp even half of the content that he expects students to know. His tests are entirely too difficult and the class averages were failing each time

1st test was 40 questions long with paragraphs of information in between questions and the class average was 60. Multiple questions had multiple answers and he refused to curve scores b/c he felt like the test had good questions. He is passionate about bio but has entirely too much information in each test and wants you to learn so much on your own

Do not take him. He nice and clearly cares about biology but all he does is read off the slides. He expects you to learn SO MUCH information. Entire class failed first two exams. Not much redemption opportunity. First exam was 40 paragraph questions in 50 min, second was 33 paragraph questions in 50 min.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: He is a nice professor who is willing to help but this class consists of extremely difficult tests with dry lectures. The class average for the first 2 exams so far have been failing grades. We only get 45- 50 minutes(with some flexibility) to take the exams despite the class being an hour and 15 minutes long. Too hard for a gen ed Bio class.

Great guy, sucks at teaching content. Reads off the slides, attendance is mandatory for IClicker pts and exams are kinda rough. His famous line is "That's a great question, We'll have to look that up idk". Doesn't have enough experience teaching BIOL 1108, take someone else.
Not a bad guy, but my Calculus II tests were 1000 times easier than his tests.

Several homework assignments weekly. Test heavy as there were 40 paragraph questions that needed to be completed in 50 mins in class. Participation and attendance is taken for every class through iClicker. Group assignments that are graded for accuracy. Grades are based on a 900 point system.

I took this class for CSM, and he was an amazing professor. The class was very simple and straightforward, and an easy A if you participated and did the work. There were minimal assignments, but the class was very group project heavy. Everything he taught was easy to understand. The only issue I found was occasional late grading. Regardless, 10/10.
